class.name: FractionFormat

javadoc.text: Formats a Fraction number in proper format or improper format. The number * format for each of the whole number, numerator and, denominator can be * configured.
Create an improper formatting instance with the default number format * for the numerator and denominator.
Create an improper formatting instance with a custom number format for * both the numerator and denominator.
javadoc.param: format the custom format for both the numerator and denominator.

javadoc.text: Create an improper formatting instance with a custom number format for * the numerator and a custom number format for the denominator.
javadoc.param: numeratorFormat the custom format for the numerator.
denominatorFormat the custom format for the denominator.

javadoc.text: Get the set of locales for which complex formats are available. This * is the same set as the {@link NumberFormat} set.
This static method calls formatFraction() on a default instance of * FractionFormat.
javadoc.return: a formatted fraction in proper form.

javadoc.text: Returns the default complex format for the current locale.
Returns the default complex format for the given locale.
javadoc.param: locale the specific locale used by the format.
javadoc.return: the complex format specific to the given locale.

javadoc.text: Returns the default complex format for the current locale.
Returns the default complex format for the given locale.
javadoc.param: locale the specific locale used by the format.
javadoc.return: the complex format specific to the given locale.

javadoc.text: Create a default number format. The default number format is based on{@link NumberFormat#getNumberInstance(java.util.Locale)} with the only * customizing is the maximum number of fraction digits, which is set to 0.
Formats a {@link Fraction} object to produce a string. The fraction is * output in improper format.
javadoc.param: toAppendTo where the text is to be appended
pos On input: an alignment field, if desired. On output: the * offsets of the alignment field
javadoc.return: the value passed in as toAppendTo.

javadoc.text: Formats an object and appends the result to a StringBuffer. obj must be either a{@link Fraction} object or a {@link Number} object. Any other type of * object will result in an {@link IllegalArgumentException} being thrown.
javadoc.param: toAppendTo where the text is to be appended
pos On input: an alignment field, if desired. On output: the * offsets of the alignment field
javadoc.return: the value passed in as toAppendTo.
javadoc.throws: FractionConversionException if the number cannot be converted to a fraction
MathIllegalArgumentException if obj is not a valid type.

javadoc.text: Parses a string to produce a {@link Fraction} object.
javadoc.exception: MathParseException if the beginning of the specified string * cannot be parsed.
